meanings.definition: To stare defiantly or boldly at someone until they look away.
meanings.sent1: She outstared the bully, showing no fear.
meanings.sent2: The cat outstared the dog, claiming its territory.
meanings.sent3: The little girl outstared her brother in a playful game of who blinks first.
meanings.sent4: His determination outstared any doubts that tried to creep in.
meanings.sent5: The intense gaze of the owl outstared all other creatures in the forest.

meanings.definition: To defeat or surpass in a staring contest.
meanings.sent1: He outstared his friend in the staring competition, winning with a grin.
meanings.sent2: The siblings outstared each other in a friendly competition.
meanings.sent3: The robot outstared the human in the unusual contest.
meanings.sent4: Her focus outstared all distractions, leading her to victory.
meanings.sent5: The champion outstared all opponents, claiming the title once again.
